intro: Pulsatilloides obtusiloba, commonly known as the blunt-lobed pulsatilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and a distinctive, fragrant blossom that typically appears in early spring. Its growth habit is herbaceous, with a short, thick stem that supports the single or few flowers. The species is adapted to high-altitude environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
